# Draft:Lovraj Talwar

Lovraj Talwar is an Indian businessman and entrepreneur based in the United Arab Emirates. He is the Managing Director of the Terrazzo Group and the founder of Emirates Rebar Ltd., companies that have supplied building materials to many of the UAE’s most iconic development projects.
Early Life and Education
Lovraj Talwar was born in Mumbai, India, into an industrialist family. His father, Pran Nath Talwar, was the founder of the Nitco Group (Northern India Tiles Corporation). He studied at Mayo College, Ajmer, and graduated from Sydenham College in Mumbai. Though he intended to study in the United States, his father insisted on hands-on training in business instead.
Career
In the late 1970s, Talwar helped expand the family business to the UAE, forming a joint venture in Sharjah to manufacture terrazzo tiles and related products. One of their first major projects was flooring for Abu Dhabi International Airport. By 1980, Talwar relocated to Dubai full-time.
Terrazzo Group
Founded in 1977, the Terrazzo Group is the Gulf region’s largest manufacturer of high-end construction materials. Under Talwar’s leadership, it supplies flooring, precast concrete, glass-reinforced concrete, and more to projects like the Burj Khalifa, Palm Jumeirah, Dubai Airport, and Yas Island.
Emirates Rebar Ltd.
In the mid-1990s, Talwar founded Emirates Rebar Ltd. to meet growing demand for factory-fabricated rebar in UAE infrastructure. The company is affiliated with the Bukhatir Group.
Trade House Ltd.
Talwar is also a stakeholder in Trade House Ltd., a trading firm that sources and supplies building materials, complementing his vertically integrated construction group.
Awards and Recognition
While not widely publicized, Talwar has been featured in major media for his role in UAE's construction sector. His leadership is credited with involvement in nearly every major development in the country. He was also on the inaugural Emirates Airlines flight in 1985.
Personal Life
Lovraj Talwar is married to Dolly Talwar and has three children: Priyanka, Diya, and Yuvraj. The family has resided in Dubai since the 1980s.
He is also a noted art collector with works by M.F. Husain, Akbar Padamsee, and others. He owns a ranch outside Dubai that houses gazelles, emus, monkeys, and exotic birds. Talwar is deeply spiritual and often visits temples and gurdwaras during trips to India.
